channel.title: opatch on Blog and reference
channel.description: Recent content in opatch on Blog and reference

item.title: opatch error: Perl lib version (v5.8.3) doesnt match executable version (v5.6.1) at x:/oracle...
Problem: opatch fails with 'The patch directory area must be a number'
item.description: opatch failed with the above error. Again its really a problem with the wetware (i.e. me), but worth typing up as its fairly obscure. The problem seems to have been that I was logged in as a different user on the server which holds our staging area when I copied the software across. I mapped the drive on the the target server as the Oracle user, but it still seems to have inherited the wrong ownership at some level.

item.title: opatch - make sure there's no space on the end of TRUE
item.description: I’ve been having problems with opatch. todo - fix the link Setting ACTIVE_STATE_PERL=TRUE cured at least one of these (although I’m not sure that I didn’t patch at least once without the setting, because there was another version of perl - mksnt - on the server) as per the previous post Its sometimes failed, then worked without me being entirely sure what I changed in the meantime. Last night I sussed that at least some of this is caused by having a space following the ACTIVE_STATE_PERL=TRUE
